body:
At Myer, we stock over 150 denim styles, ensuring there is something to suit every denim taste, but how do you find your perfect pair in the sea of blue? There are four key considerations to help you narrow the field:


• Brand

• Fit

• Wash and colour

• Distress and trend details


This Learning Moment examines these topics in turn, so you’ll know exactly what to look for on your next denim shopping journey.
displayTitle: SHOPPING IN A SEA OF BLUE
title: Text Title

body: Most people shop for denim in the brands they know and love. Below are 13 of the most wanted men's denim brands.
title: Text Title

body: Press the denim cards to learn more.
title: PressCard_icon

_items.backText:
Levi's began in San Francisco where it invented the blue jean. Today, it's a trusted household brand that uses its past to inspire its current collections, with denim fits to suit classic and modern tastes.

Available at all Myer stores.

Calvin Klein Jeans use innovative stretch fabric and clean seaming to create modern denim fits. The brand is also loved for its unique denim details and treatments.

Available at all Myer stores.

Jack & Jones is one of Europe's leading menswear brands, with denim at its core. It takes an environmentally responsible approach to the denim life cycle, from raw materials and production, to reusing and recycling.

Available at selected Myer stores.

Kenji is a trend-driven brand with a skinny denim range exclusive to Myer. The uncomplicated denim styles complement Kenji's easy-to-wear wardrobe staples to create the perfect casual weekend look.

Available at all Myer stores.

Maddox offers straight and slim-fit jeans for those who want a basic denim look with a subtly tailored edge. The range of dark colours make these jeans easy to dress up for any occasion.

Available at all Myer stores.

JAG is Australia’s original denim brand, with humble beginnings as the first fashion store on Melbourne’s shop-till-you-drop Chapel Street. Its 40-plus years of denim expertise is reflected in its highly crafted pieces, which mix classic with contemporary, exciting with functional.

Available at all Myer stores.

Abrand was launched in 2013 by Melbourne-based denim house Threebyone. It’s all about fit, finish and fabric – and dressing to express. Its brand and ranges are influenced by street culture, art, music, photography and a desire to be associated with the good times.

Available at selected Myer stores.

As the younger sibling to the Lee brand, Riders by Lee reflects a cool, youthful lifestyle and takes inspiration from street styles across the globe.

Available at all Myer stores.

Industrie is a menswear favourite with its distinct brand of casual-cool. Its denim defies conformity with unique distress effects, pocket detailing and wash colours.

Available at selected Myer stores.

Hailing from Melbourne in 2010, Ziggy Denim is designed with a rebellious, irreverent streak in mind. Its collections reference bygone times, but add a modern twist. Traditional washed-blue denims and blacks are overlaid with innovative washes and splashes of seasonal colour.

Available at selected Myer stores.

Rolla’s embodies the laid-back personality and love for jeans of the place where it was born – Australia. It pays homage to the era when jeans came into their own, and has brought back classic cuts with modern design aesthetics.

Available at selected Myer stores.

Wrangler began as a denim company that produced durable work clothes for railway workers on America's east coast. In 2003, Wrangler Australia was born; its small Melbourne team works with the world's best denim suppliers to create heritage-inspired denim collections.

Available at selected Myer stores.

Founded in Amsterdam in 2008, Denham denim is developed in collaboration with the best Italian and Japanese denim mills. Each jean is imprinted with several signature details, including 691 stitches in the Denham scissor logo, printed interior yoke panels, and embossed copper rivets.

Available at selected Myer stores.

body:
An important consideration when shopping for denim is the fit. Chances are, you own at least one pair of jeans and already know a little about the way they can fit.


Test your knowledge in this activity by looking at each denim fit and identifying the cut of the leg.


Press submit for feedback on your selection, plus a little extra information on denim rise, which is where the waistband of the jeans sits on the body.
title: Text Title

Skinny jeans are tight from hip to ankle, and have stretch qualities for comfort. This trend is usually braved by younger denim wearers and worn lower on the hip.

Straight jeans are fitted at the thighs, then cut straight down from the knee to ankle. The subtle tailoring gives this style a polished look.

body:
Next on the agenda when shopping for denim is colour.


About 75% of all denim begins dark indigo in colour. Also known as raw denim, it feels rigid and looks plain. A wash and treatment process softens the fabric and gives it a worn-in look. The longer the wash process, the lighter the denim colour.


Check out some innovative wash and treatment techniques in this video by Jack & Jones.

_audio.ariaLabel: This button will play an audio description of the video

_media.ariaLabel: This button will play the video

title: Media Title

body:
With a particular denim colour in mind, the next step is to consider the distress and trend details that give your jeans character and a lived-in appearance. Look out for brands like Jack & Jones and Denham, which are known for their innovative denim distressing techniques, often carefully crafted by hand.


Here are a few details and how they are created.

_items.body:
FADING


Abrasive materials such as pumice stones or sandpaper are rubbed or scraped onto targeted areas of the garment to create a faded effect.

WHISKERING


The denim is folded and hand-sanded to create long, stretched lines that look like whiskers. This technique is applied to areas where denim naturally creases with wear.

HONEYCOMBING


Using a similar technique to whiskering, shorter, closed creases that look like the cells of a honeycomb are created to give the appearance of wear behind the knees.

RIPS


Hand-held sanding tools and sharp scraping implements are applied to the denim to create rips and the desirable level of damage.

title: Narrative Title

body: When it comes to shopping for denim, knowing what to look for can make a good choice a great one. Here are some need-to-knows that can make that difference for you.

_items.title: SIZE vs FIT
_items.body:
Slight variations in cut and fabrication can change the way a pair of denim jeans fits. This can happen with the same brand and is common between brands.


When buying denim, use sizes as a guide and experiment until you find the perfect fit. To account for the natural stretch in denim, they should fit firmly but not feel uncomfortable.

_items.title: LEG LENGTHS
_items.body:
Men's denim comes in three leg lengths, measured from the crotch of the denim to the ankle:

Short - 30 inches

Regular - 32 inches

Long - 34 inches

Unless specified, all denim legs are regular length.

For the extra-tall man, Jack & Jones also offers 36-inch leg lengths.

_items.title: TAPERING
_items.body: Wider denim cuts can taper towards the ankle, a look favoured by men with athletic legs. The amount of tapering can transform the way jeans look on your body, so it’s a good idea to try them on before you buy them.
Rather than hemming the length of your jeans, consider rolling them up for an on-trend look. This is a great way of highlighting any piping or stitched cuff details.
_items.title: CUFFING

_items.body: A denim purchase is an investment in quality, craftsmanship and design that, with good care, should last many years. Refer to the Rules of Denim Care Learning Moment for tips that will ensure your new purchase goes the distance.
_items.title: CARE

title: Accordion Title

body:
Now that you’ve completed this Learning Moment, you should be feeling confident about denim shopping and talking the denim talk. Your denim repertoire includes knowledge of:


• Popular brands

• Denim fit

• Wash and colour

• Distress and trend details


Get the word out there and share your love for shopping and wearing denim.
title: Text Title

body: Take a look at the men's denim range at Myer.
